short_summary: Salmon Patrol Services for Middle Johnstone Strait and Mainland Inlets
description: The department requires a standing offer for Salmon Patrol Services. The contractor will provide fish enumeration surveys in Pacific Fishery Management Areas 12, 13, and 14, and will be called up on an as-needed basis. The contract period is from February 1, 2023 to January 31, 2028.
full_summary:
### Orders for Patrol Services Middle Johnstone Strait & Mainland Inlets

[English URL to PDF Document](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/01/58e7cdc1c0b5eee2cd2d1659db6f73ff/30002835_-_rfso_middle_johnstone_strait_mainland_inlets_en.pdf)
[French URL to PDF Document](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/01/9f38e91acf7d44bbf2cc9a59b794cbdf/30002835_-_rfso_middle_johnstone_strait_mainland_inlets_fr.pdf)

**Tender Details**
* Reference Number: PW-22-01015480
* Solicitation Number: 30002835
* Closing Date: 2023-01-17T13:00:00 (Expired)
* Procurement Category: SRV
* Tender Status: Expired
* Tender Method: Competitive - Open Bidding

**Tender Description**
Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) seeks to establish a standing offer for Patrol Services in the Middle Johnstone Strait & Mainland Inlets area. The contractors will conduct stream enumeration surveys for salmon by swimming or on-foot in Pacific Fishery Management Areas 12, 13, and 14. The standing offer will remain in effect from February 1, 2023 to January 31, 2028. DFO reserves the right to utilize the contractor's services on an as and when required basis, contingent upon resource manager discussions and assessments regarding the season and effort.

**Procurement Information**
* Contracting Entity: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* Contracting Entity Address: 200 Kent St, Station 13E228, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0E6, Canada
* Contact Person: Kimberly Walker | DWFredericton NB  E3B 3A8 Courriel: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

### End User Entities
* End User Entities: Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO)

### Trade Agreement Requirements
This solicitation aligns with the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

The rewritten entry maintain the essential details of the uncommon contractor-provided release. Rewritten GIN informations were omitted for brevity as they are presumed as useful for categorization,
